content.question: Which of the following statements best supports the claim that certain organelles within eukaryotic cells evolved from free-living prokaryotic cells?

choices.label: The cytoplasm of both eukaryotes and prokaryotes is surrounded by a plasma membrane.
Eukaryotes and prokaryotes both contain ribosomes, but the ribosomes of eukaryotes are more complex in structure than those of prokaryotes.
Eukaryotes exchange segments of internal membranes between the endoplasmic reticulum and Golgi apparatus, but prokaryotes have no such internal membranes.

Some organelles contain their own <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> that is more similar to prokaryotic <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> in structure and function than to the eukaryotic <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> found in the cell's nucleus.

content.answer: Some organelles contain their own <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> that is more similar to prokaryotic <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> in structure and function than to the eukaryotic <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> found in the cell's nucleus.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
